translation.title: The Decline of the True Teaching (3rd)

previous.name: The Decline of the True Teaching (2nd)

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 16. Saddhammavagga
segments.en: 16. The True Teaching

segments.pli: 156. Tatiyasaddhammasammosasutta
segments.en: 156. The Decline of the True Teaching (3rd)

segments.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū duggahitaṃ suttantaṃ pariyāpuṇanti dunnikkhittehi padabyañjanehi.
segments.en: It’s when the mendicants memorize discourses that they learned incorrectly, with misplaced words and phrases.

segments.pli: Dunnikkhittassa, bhikkhave, padabyañjanassa atthopi dunnayo hoti.
segments.en: When the words and phrases are misplaced, the meaning is misinterpreted.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the first thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū dubbacā honti, dovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgatā, akkhamā appadakkhiṇaggāhino anusāsaniṃ.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants are hard to admonish, having qualities that make them hard to admonish. They’re impatient, and don’t take instruction respectfully.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the second thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ye te bhikkhū bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā, te na sakkaccaṃ suttantaṃ paraṃ vācenti;
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants who are very learned—knowledgeable in the scriptures, who have memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines—don’t carefully make others recite the discourses.

segments.pli: tesaṃ accayena chinnamūlako suttanto hoti appaṭisaraṇo.
segments.en: When they pass away, the discourses are cut off at the root, with no-one to preserve them.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the third thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, therā bhikkhū bāhulikā honti sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā, na vīriyaṃ ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
segments.en: Furthermore, the senior mendicants are indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion, not rousing energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ pacchimā janatā diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: Those who come after them follow their example.

segments.pli: Sāpi hoti bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā, na vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
segments.en: They too are indulgent and slack …

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fourth thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃgho bhinno hoti.
segments.en: Furthermore, there’s a schism in the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Saṃghe kho pana, bhikkhave, bhinne aññamaññaṃ akkosā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ paribhāsā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ parikkhepā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ pariccajanā ca honti.
segments.en: When the Saṅgha is split, they abuse, insult, block, and reject each other.

segments.pli: Tattha appasannā ceva nappasīdanti, pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattaṃ hoti.
segments.en: This doesn’t inspire confidence in those without it, and it causes some with confidence to change their minds.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suggahitaṃ suttantaṃ pariyāpuṇanti sunikkhittehi padabyañjanehi.
segments.en: It’s when the mendicants memorize discourses that have been learned correctly, with well placed words and phrases.

segments.pli: Sunikkhittassa, bhikkhave, padabyañjanassa atthopi sunayo hoti.
segments.en: When the words and phrases are well organized, the meaning is correctly interpreted.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the first thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suvacā honti sovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgatā, khamā padakkhiṇaggāhino anusāsaniṃ.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants are easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish. They’re patient, and take instruction respectfully.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the second thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ye te bhikkhū bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā, te sakkaccaṃ suttantaṃ paraṃ vācenti;
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants who are very learned—knowledgeable in the scriptures, who have memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines—carefully make others recite the discourses.

segments.pli: tesaṃ accayena na chinnamūlako suttanto hoti sappaṭisaraṇo.
segments.en: When they pass away, the discourses aren’t cut off at the root, and they have someone to preserve them.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the third thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, therā bhikkhū na bāhulikā honti na sāthalikā, okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā; vīriyaṃ ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
segments.en: Furthermore, the senior mendicants are not indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion. They rouse energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ pacchimā janatā diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjati.
segments.en: Those who come after them follow their example.

segments.pli: Sāpi hoti na bāhulikā na sāthalikā, okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā, vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
segments.en: They too are not indulgent or slack …

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fourth thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, saṅgho samaggo sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsuṃ viharati.
segments.en: Furthermore, the Saṅgha lives comfortably, in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, with one recitation.

segments.pli: Saṅghe kho pana, bhikkhave, samagge na ceva aññamaññaṃ akkosā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ paribhāsā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ parikkhepā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ pariccajanā honti.
segments.en: When the Saṅgha is in harmony, they don’t abuse, insult, block, or reject each other.

segments.pli: Tattha appasannā ceva pasīdanti, pasannānañca bhiyyobhāvo hoti.
segments.en: This inspires confidence in those without it, and increases confidence in those who have it.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fifth thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.
